revisions.rev:
{| class="infobox" style="width: 28em; font-size: 95%;" |- | colspan="2" style="text-align: center; font-size: 150%;" | '''The Apple Cup''' |- | '''Number of meetings''' | 104 |- | '''First meeting''' | UW 5, WSU 5 (1900) |- | '''Last meeting''' | UW 38, WSU 21 (2011) |- | '''Next meeting''' | November 23, 2012 |- | '''All-time series''' | UW leads 67â31â6 |- | '''Largest victory''' | UW, 51-3 (2000) |- | '''Current streak''' | UW, 3 (2009â2011) |- | '''Longest UW win streak''' | 8 (1959â66 & 1974â81) |- | '''Longest WSU win streak''' | 2 (8 times) |- | '''Trophy''' | The Apple Cup |- |} [[File:Gregoire Apple Cup.jpg|thumb|[[Washington (U.S. state)|Washington]] governor [[Chris Gregoire]] prepares to present the Apple Cup to the winner of the 2007 Apple Cup.]] The '''Apple Cup''' is the [[trophy]] awarded to the winner of an American [[college football]] [[college rivalry|rivalry]] game played annually by the teams of the two largest universities in the [[U.S. state]] of [[Washington (U.S. state)|Washington]]: the [[University of Washington]] (UW) [[Washington Huskies football|Huskies]] and the [[Washington State University]] (WSU) [[Washington State Cougars football|Cougars]]. It is traditionally the final game of the regular season and takes place on the Saturday preceding [[Thanksgiving]] at [[Husky Stadium]] in [[Seattle]] during odd years, and WSU's [[Martin Stadium]] in [[Pullman, Washington|Pullman]] during even years, but with college football season extending, the game is often played at a later date. ==Series history== From 1950 to 1980 (except for 1954), the WSU home games in the series were played at [[Spokane, Washington|Spokane's]] [[Joe Albi Stadium]]. The WSU Cougars won three of these fifteen games in Spokane (1958, 1968, 1972), and have won six of the fourteen played at [[Martin Stadium]] (1982, 1988, 1992, 1994, 2004, 2008). Before 1962, the teams played for the "Governor's Trophy." The game was renamed the "Apple Cup" in 1962 because of Washington's famous apple crop. The Apple Cup trophy has been awarded to the winning team ever since. With the lengthening of the college football regular season schedule to 12 games in 2006, there was a movement to change the date of the Apple Cup from the weekend before [[Thanksgiving]] to the weekend following. This would have allowed a bye week during the season. In the 2006 season, both teams played 12 straight weeks without a break, leaving the two teams noticeably fatigued. For the first time, the 2007 edition of the Apple Cup was played two days after Thanksgiving. The Apple Cup has been sponsored by [[Boeing]] since 2007.[http://gohuskies.cstv.com/sports/m-footbl/spec-rel/090607aac.html "Boeing To Present Apple Cup."] Gohuskies.com. September 6, 2007. The first rivalry game was held in 1900 and resulted in a tie between UW and WSU. From 1900 to 2011, there have been 104 games between the schools. The Huskies were the home team 58 times (all in Seattle). The Cougars were the home team 46 times (31 in Pullman, 15 in Spokane). The Huskies hold a 67â31â6 advantage. The UW's longest winning streak has been eight games, achieved twice: (1959â66 and 1974â81). WSU has never won more than two consecutive Apple Cups, but the Cougars have won back-to-back games on eight separate occasions: (1929â30, 1953â54, 1957â58, 1967â68, 1972â73, 1982â83, 2004â05 and 2007â08). Washington currently holds the trophy for three straight years. In 2009, the Cougars were shut out 30â0 at Husky Stadium, UW's first shutout since 1964. In 2010, the Huskies defeated the Cougars 35-28. The 104th and most recent Apple Cup on November 26, 2011 was won 38-21 by UW, playing at [[CenturyLink Field]] in [[Seattle]] due to renovations at [[Husky Stadium]]. ==Game results== {|class="wikitable" align=center |-align=center valign=top |-align=center |colspan=3|56 won by the home team* |colspan=3|42 won by the visiting team |colspan=3 style="background:lightgrey; color:#000000" |6 tied games |-align=center |style="background:#310062; color:gold" |UW*

Tie:6 |} ==Other sports== The annual softball game in [[Washington, D.C.]], between the teams affiliated with the Washington State GOP and the Washington State Democrats is also commonly referred to as the "Apple Cup." The teams compete in the House of Representatives softball league, and the GOP team has won the Apple Cup for the past 3 years. ==References== {{Reflist}} ==External links== *[http://www.gohuskies.com/sports/m-footbl/wash-m-footbl-body.html University of Washington Huskies Football] *[http://www.wsucougars.com/sports/m-footbl/wast-m-footbl-body.html Washington State University Cougars Football] {{Washington Huskies football navbox}} {{Washington State Cougars football navbox}} {{Pacific-12 Conference football rivalry navbox}} [[Category:College football rivalries in the United States]] [[Category:College football rivalry trophies in the United States]] [[Category:Washington Huskies football]] [[Category:Washington State Cougars football]] [[zh:èæç]]
